title: HBO releases spinoff 'Game of Thrones' trailer
description: HBO Max revealed the teaser trailer for its "Game of Thrones" spinoff, "House of the Dragon." The series will premiere in 2022.

title: Former Tesla contractor awarded $137 million in racial harassment suit
description: A former worker at Tesla's Fremont, California, factory was subjected to a racially hostile workplace, according to a federal jury, which awarded him $136.9 million in damages Monday.

title: Analysis: China acts more aggressive abroad as it cracks down at home
description: China's incursions near Taiwan help train their air force, while wearing down Taiwan's defenses, says national security expert Sheena Greitens.

title: William Shatner 'thrilled' and 'frightened' ahead of space flight
description: Captain James T. Kirk is getting a real chance to go to space after 55 years. Actor William Shatner says the opportunity has him "thrilled" and 'frightened' at the same time.

title: See who got kicked off the latest 'Dancing with the Stars'
description: This Netflix star was voted out by the judges and had to leave the dance floor on the 30th season of "Dancing with the Stars."

title: Capitol Police take a suspect into custody from a 'suspicious vehicle' in front of the Supreme Court
description: US Capitol Police on Tuesday took into custody a suspect from a "suspicious vehicle" parked near the Supreme Court after giving the person commands and using a flash bang device.

title: She questioned whether to have kids. Hear what made her glad she didn't
description: People around the world are factoring the climate crisis into their reproductive decisions. Britt Wray and Jade Sasser sit down for an intimate conversation about how their personal experiences with climate change impact how their families look today.

title: Analysis: Facebook revelations are shocking. But nothing will change until Congress acts
description: After a roller coaster 24 hours for Facebook — in which a whistleblower lodged damning claims at at the site, its stock fell 5% and the company suffered a more than five-hour outage across its most popular apps — the spotlight has shifted to Congress and what, if anything, lawmakers are willing to do to rein in the social media behemoth.

title: Meet Playboy's first openly gay male cover star
description: Bretman Rock has donned Playboy's famed bunny ears and become the first out gay man to star on its cover.

title: Russian actor and director lift off to film first movie made in space
description: The International Space Station is about to become a film set.

title: Daniel Craig explains why 'No Time to Die' is best experienced in a theater
description: Daniel Craig knows that with all the global challenges of the pandemic, "everything has to be put in perspective." That includes Hollywood blockbusters like his final Jame Bond film, "No Time to Die."

title: Taliban to resume issuing passports to Afghan citizens
description: Afghanistan will resume issuing passports to its citizens, its interior ministry announced Tuesday, in a first under the country's new Taliban government.

title: Trump's ex-press secretary says former administration's handling of Covid-19 was 'tragic'
description: One of former President Donald Trump's top ex-aides said Tuesday that the Republican's "vanity got in the way" of his administration's response to Covid-19.

title: Brian Laundrie's sister says she'd 'turn him in' but doesn't know where he is
description: The sister of Brian Laundrie has doubled down on her assertion she has no idea where he is, as authorities search for him after the death of his fiancee Gabby Petito.

title: 'Korean wave' sweeps Oxford English Dictionary as new words are added
description: Korean exports seem to be sweeping the world's screens, headsets and runways -- and now more than 20 words of Korean origin have been added to the Oxford English Dictionary (OED) in its September update.

title: Boris Johnson isn't worried about the UK economy. He should be
description: The United Kingdom is suffering from fuel shortages, gaps on supermarket shelves, rising inflation and slowing economic growth. Prime Minister Boris Johnson insists he isn't worried — but should he be?

title: Bitcoin prices top $50,000 for the first time in four weeks
description: The whirlwind ride for bitcoin continues. The price of the world's most valuable cryptocurrency soared above $50,000 Tuesday morning — the highest level in nearly four weeks.

title: Adele announces that a new song is coming
description: This is not a drill!

title: Beaches sit empty and fragile habitats hang in the balance as crews race to clean up California oil spill
description: A stretch of Southern California's coast has been transformed by a leak at an oil pipe that released more than 100,000 gallons of oil into the Pacific Ocean.

title: The world's most powerful passports for 2021
description: The global gap in travel freedoms has never been wider, says the latest report by London-based global citizenship and residence advisory firm Henley & Partners.

title: George Floyd's brother speaks out after statue is defaced
description: Philonise Floyd, brother of George Floyd, joins CNN New Day to talk about his brother's bust being vandalized in New York City.

title: Jamie Lee Curtis thinks cosmetic procedures are 'wiping out a generation of beauty'
description: Jamie Lee Curtis sounds like a firm believer in natural beauty.

title: Videos capture massive fireball light up sky in Colorado
description: Surveillance videos around Colorado captured a giant fireball meteor shoot across the sky. CNN affiliate KCNC reports.

title: Justin Bieber selling weed named after his hit song 'Peaches'
description: His "Peaches" single lit up the charts and now Justin Bieber wants folks to be able to light up his pre-rolled joints.

title: 'Game of Thrones' prequel official teaser is here
description: The dragons are coming.

title: John Avlon: Social media puts our impulses on steroids
description: CNN's John Avlon proposes some solutions to regulate Facebook after former employee and whistleblower Frances Haugen revealed the company knew its algorithms were amplifying division on the platform.

title: Donald Trump's allies are going to make America great again. Again. Seriously.
Nobel Prize in physics awarded for predicting global warming accurately
description: The Nobel Prize in physics has been awarded to scientists Syukuro Manabe, Klaus Hasselmann and Giorgio Parisi, for groundbreaking work in predicting global warming and for the understanding of complex physical systems.

title: NBA star on getting vaccinated: 'Not something I wanted to do, but kind of forced to'
description: Golden State Warriors forward Andrew Wiggins has said he felt like he had no choice but to get the Covid-19 vaccine.

title: 'Squid Game' sets off a new game: Trying to figure out why it took off on Netflix
description: "Squid Game" has set off its own Hollywood-centric game -- trying to explain how (or really, guess why) a South Korean drama that arrived with virtually no fanfare has become what Netflix is billing as possibly its "biggest show ever."

title: Marc Pilcher, 'Bridgerton' Emmy winner, dies age 53
description: Marc Pilcher, the award-winning hair stylist and makeup designer who won an Emmy for his work on the hit Netflix show "Bridgerton," has died of Covid-19 at the age of 53, weeks after winning the award.

title: NASA will deliberately crash into an asteroid's moon to protect Earth
description: A spacecraft that will deliberately crash into an asteroid is preparing to launch.

title: Kirsten Dunst opens the doors to her charming LA ranch house
description: With references to her career-defining roles and smatterings of family heirlooms, the personal touches throughout Dunst's 1930s ranch house make it more than just a beautiful space.

title: Chinese developer Fantasia can't pay its debts. That's stoking real estate fears
description: A Chinese developer of luxury apartments missed $315 million in payments to lenders on Monday, sparking fears that financial strains in the country's outsized property sector are spreading beyond the troubled Evergrande conglomerate.

title: Elizabeth Warren demands insider trading investigation of the Fed
description: Senator Elizabeth Warren on Monday urged the Securities and Exchange Commission to launch an insider trading investigation into transactions by high-level officials at the Federal Reserve.

title: New Zealand to abandon zero-Covid strategy as Delta variant proves hard to shake
More than 200,000 children sexually abused by French Catholic clergy, landmark report finds
description: Members of the Catholic clergy sexually abused more than 200,000 minors in France over the last seven decades, a survey carried out as part of an independent probe into abuse within the church estimates, according to the head of the commission that produced the report.

title: SE Cupp responds to Mike Pence's comments on Fox News
description: CNN's political commentator SE Cupp discusses Mike Pence's recent appearance on Fox News discussing the January 6th insurrection.

title: How a grandmother's belief gave birth to an African soccer superstar
description: Asisat Oshoala has a confession to make.

title: Former Chinese detective in exile exposes torture methods used to force Uyghurs to confess
description: The raids started after midnight in Xinjiang.

title: Jacinda Ardern explains why New Zealand is ending zero-Covid strategy
description: New Zealand's Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern announces the country is moving from eliminating Covid-19, amid a persistent outbreak of the Delta variant, and will instead transition to a strategy of 'living with the virus.'

title: Taliban accused of killing 13 ethnic Hazaras in Afghanistan
description: Taliban forces unlawfully killed 13 ethnic Hazaras -- including nine surrendering former government soldiers and a 17-year-old girl -- in Afghanistan's Daykundi province on August 30, according to a new investigation by Amnesty International.

title: Global stocks steady after Wall Street drop unsettles Asia
description: Stocks in the United States and Europe steadied on Tuesday after Asian markets were rattled overnight by fears of a potential US default, trouble in China's massive property market and rising oil prices.

title: 5 things to know about China's record surge of warplanes near Taiwan
description: China's record number of incursions of warplanes into Taiwan's defense zone over the past four days plays to Beijing's military strengths while sending potent messages both at home and far beyond the self-governed island, Western analysts say.

title: Instagram's grim appeal as a silent self-esteem breaker
description: One 17-year-old girl I see for therapy has a daily "selfie process" that can take an hour or more.

title: Taiwan puts out propaganda video as China makes incursion into air zone
description: Taiwan's Defense Ministry said 56 Chinese warplanes made incursions into its air defense identification zone on Monday, the highest number since the island began publicly reporting such activities last year. CNN's Will Ripley has more.

title: Singapore passes law to tackle 'foreign interference,' giving authorities the power to block internet content
description: Singapore's Parliament has approved a law giving broad powers to the government to deal with foreign interference -- sparking concern from the opposition and experts about its wide scope and limits on judicial review.

title: Acts of resistance from women living under Taliban rule
description: CNN's Clarissa Ward reports on the different everyday small acts of defiance some women are taking in Kabul as the Taliban continues to push women out of civic life.

title: You've never seen Barbie like this before
description: Barbie becomes weightless on zero-gravity flight. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on the gravity of her astronaut training.
